citation.article-title: Anaeroglobus geminatus gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Veillonellaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Anaeroglobus (An.ae.ro.glo'bus. Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air ; N.L. anaero not (living) in air; L. masc. n. globus sphere; N.L. masc. n. Anaeroglobus a sphere not living in air)
Cells are Gram-negative after coloration and coccoid to ellipsoidal, usually in pairs or, occasionally, in short chains, non-spore-forming, non-motile.
Growth in broth media is poor.
Metabolic end products in TGY are acetate, propionate, isobutyrate, butyrate and isovalerate.
The DNA G+C content is 51.8 mol%.
Members of the genus can be distinguished from other genera of the family Veillonellaceae by metabolic end products and 16S rDNA gene sequences.
The type species is Anaeroglobus geminatus.
